dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, another wild day on the markets, huh? After that thousand-point jump on Monday, I honestly thought Tuesday was going to be a total washout.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, another wild day on the markets, huh? After that thousand-point jump on Monday, I honestly thought Tuesday was going to be a total washout.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After Mondays 1000-point drop, major stock market losses continued on Tuesday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? I mean, U.S. futures were plummeting overnight, looked like a clear decline was coming. But then, uh, nope! Stocks mostly finished in the green.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? I mean, U S. futures were plummeting overnight, looked like a clear decline was coming. But then, uh, nope! Stocks mostly finished in the green.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. futures had rallied slightly overnight following Mondays losses, seemingly pointing to a Tuesday rebound, but stocks largely remained in the red during the day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. Investors just piled into risky assets. Dow up 879 points, S&P gained three percent, and the Nasdaq, like, jumped 2.8%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. Investors just piled into risky assets. Dow up eight hundred seventy nine points, S and P gained three percent, and the Nasdaq, like, jumped two point eight percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow dropped 879 points, or 3.1%, while the S&P 500 lost 3% and the Nasdaq Composite lost 2.8%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's that perceived waning of the coronavirus threat, isn't it? People just getting all optimistic, eschewing safer havens like bonds.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's that perceived waning of the coronavirus threat, isn't it? People just getting all optimistic, eschewing safer havens like bonds.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...fears over the spread of the coronavirus intensified and investors fled risky assets in favor of safer ones, like bonds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And get this: 10-year U.S. Treasury yields soared to a record high. The yield curve, that recession indicator, even normalized on Monday. Sounds good, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And get this: ten-year U S. Treasury yields soared to a record high. The yield curve, that recession indicator, even normalized on Monday. Sounds good, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 10-year U.S. Treasury yields hit a record low on Tuesday after the yield curvea measure of the difference between 3-month and 10-year bond yields that is widely used as a recession indicatorinverted on Monday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Which, you know, usually is a good sign. But then you read this article, and it says the CDC announced the coronavirus was, quote, "demonstrably contained" and posed no further threat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, usually is a good sign. But then you read this article, and it says the C D C announced the coronavirus was, quote, demonstrably contained and posed no further threat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CDC said on Tuesday that the coronavirus is expected to cause a global pandemic...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! Which is just... *wild* to even read. Like, really? Completely reversed its global impact?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! Which is just... wild to even read. Like, really? Completely reversed its global impact?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah. And then in the very next breath, you have Larry Kudlow warning CNBC that it's poised to become an economic disaster.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah. And then in the very next breath, you have Larry Kudlow warning C N B C that it's poised to become an economic disaster.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: National Economic Council director Larry Kudlow had a more optimistic view, telling CNBCs Kelly Evans that the coronavirus has been contained in the United States and that the outbreak is not likely to be an economic tragedy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's such a mixed message! And even Nouriel Roubini, usually pretty bearish, he's saying the epidemic is likely less severe than expected and China's boost will help global supply chains.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's such a mixed message! And even Nouriel Roubini, usually pretty bearish, he's saying the epidemic is likely less severe than expected and China's boost will help global supply chains.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The epidemic is likely to be more severe than currently expected, and the disruption to the Chinese economy will have spillover effects on global supply chains including pharma inputs, of which China is a critical supplier and business confidence, all of which will likely be more severe than financial markets current complacency suggests, the economist Nouriel Roubini... wrote...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Yeah, he's like, markets are *underestimating* the positive effects!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he's like, markets are underestimating the positive effects!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then, the article's own 'further reading' section ends with, like, 'experts now advise extreme panic.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, the article's own further reading section ends with, like, experts now advise extreme panic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Further reading: Even with these major losses, experts say you shouldnt panic yet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah, 'no silver lining,' 'investors expected to sell off.' It's just... what are we supposed to make of all this conflicting info?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah, no silver lining, investors expected to sell off. It's just... what are we supposed to make of all this conflicting info?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One silver lining? Investors typically buy the dip following big drops.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it sounds like the market *felt* contained for a minute there on Tuesday, but the underlying sentiment from, you know, the actual experts... it's a mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it sounds like the market felt contained for a minute there on Tuesday, but the underlying sentiment from, you know, the actual experts... it's a mess.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. A real head-scratcher out there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. A real head-scratcher out there.
